Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • GeometricFigure
      • Circle

  • public class Circle
extends GeometricFigure
    This class represents a two dimensional circle defined by one point and one double, they represent the center of the circle and radius, respectively.
    Since:
    13/11/2016
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Andre Pedro, Ricardo Reais, Vasco Carvalho
    See Also:
    Point

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Point p
      Point p is the center of the circle.
      private double r
      r is the radius of the circle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Circle(double r)
      The creation of a valid circle implies that the radius of the circle is above zero, because a distance can't be negative.
      Circle(Point p, double r)
      The creation of a valid circle implies that the radius of the circle is above zero, because a distance can't be negative.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double area() 
      Point getCenter() 
      double getRadius() 
      protected boolean intersects(LineSegment ls)
      The intersection is reviewed by measuring the distance between the circle and the line segment, if this distance is bigger than the radius of the circle, then there is no intersection, if it is smaller, then there is intersection and finally if it is zero the circle is collinear to the line segment.
      double perimeter() 
      void setCenter(Point p)
      Defines the center of the circle.
      void setRadius(double r)
      Defines the radius of the circle.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the object.

    • Field Detail

      • p

        private Point p
        Point p is the center of the circle.

      • r

        private double r
        r is the radius of the circle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Circle

        public Circle(double r)
        The creation of a valid circle implies that the radius of the circle is above zero, because a distance can't be negative. In this constructor the center of the circle is not given, so we assume that the center of the circle is the point with coordinates (0,0).
        Parameters:
        r - circle radius.

      • Circle

        public Circle(Point p,
              double r)
        The creation of a valid circle implies that the radius of the circle is above zero, because a distance can't be negative.
        Parameters:
        p - circle center point.
        r - circle radius.

    • Method Detail

      • setCenter

        public void setCenter(Point p)
        Defines the center of the circle.
        Parameters:
        p - New circle center point.

      • setRadius

        public void setRadius(double r)
        Defines the radius of the circle.
        Parameters:
        r - New circle radius.

      • getRadius

        public double getRadius()
        Returns:
        The radius of the circle.

      • getCenter

        public Point getCenter()
        Returns:
        The center point of the circle.

      • area

        public double area()
        Specified by:
        area in class GeometricFigure
        Returns:
        The circle area, using the formula PI * r * r.

      • perimeter

        public double perimeter()
        Specified by:
        perimeter in class GeometricFigure
        Returns:
        The circle perimeter, using the formula 2 * PI * r.

      • intersects

        protected boolean intersects(LineSegment ls)
        The intersection is reviewed by measuring the distance between the circle and the line segment, if this distance is bigger than the radius of the circle, then there is no intersection, if it is smaller, then there is intersection and finally if it is zero the circle is collinear to the line segment.
        Specified by:
        intersects in class GeometricFigure
        Parameters:
        ls - The line segment to review the intersection.
        Returns:
        True if the circle intersects the line segment, else false.
        See Also:
        LineSegment

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Characteristics of the Circle.
